CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The weak electron - donating characteristic of TA , which has 2-D extended conjugation by thiophene side groups , makes the copolymer exhibit a low - lying HOMO level of -5.5 eV with a low band - gap of 1.65 eV , which affords both high photo - voltage and photocurrent of the polymer solar cells.

Let's think step by step.
1. TA: This is the name of the material mentioned in the paragraph. It is a copolymer with 2-D extended conjugation through thiophene side groups.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.
1. TA: This is the name of the material mentioned in the paragraph, which is a copolymer with 2-D extended conjugation through thiophene side groups.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The weak electron - donating characteristic of TA , which has 2-D extended conjugation by thiophene side groups , makes the copolymer exhibit a low - lying HOMO level of -5.5 eV with a low band - gap of 1.65 eV , which affords both high photo - voltage and photocurrent of the polymer solar cells.

Let's think step by step.

1. TA: This is a specific chemical compound or polymer mentioned in the paragraph. It can be considered as a "Compound/Material" property.
2. 2-D extended conjugation: This refers to the two-dimensional arrangement of conjugated systems in the copolymer. It can be considered as a "Structural Property" of the copolymer.
3. Thiophene side groups: These are specific chemical groups attached to the copolymer. They can be considered as "Functional Group" properties.
4. HOMO level: This stands for Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital level. It is a quantum mechanical property of the copolymer related to its electron affinity.
5. -5.5 eV: This is a numerical value representing the energy level of the HOMO level of the copolymer. It can be considered as an "Energy Level" property.
6. Low band gap: This refers to the small energy difference between the valence band and the conduction band in the copolymer. It can be considered as an "Energy Gap" property.
7. 1.65 eV: This is a numerical value representing the band gap of the copolymer. It can be considered as an "Energy Gap" property.
8. High photo-voltage: This is a property related to the voltage generated in the polymer solar cells when they absorb photons. It can be considered as a "Performance Property" of the solar cells.
9. High photocurrent: This is a property related to the amount of electrical current generated in the polymer solar cells when they absorb photons. It can be considered as a "Performance Property" of the solar cells.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. TA: This is a specific copolymer mentioned in the paragraph. It is the material of interest.
2. 2-D extended conjugation: This refers to the two-dimensional arrangement of conjugated systems in the copolymer, which affects its electronic properties and can be considered as a structural property of the copolymer.
3. HOMO level: This is a quantum mechanical property of the copolymer related to its electron affinity, which is a material property.
4. Low band gap: This is a material property of the copolymer related to its ability to conduct electricity, which is influenced by the energy difference between its valence and conduction bands.
5. High photo-voltage: This is a performance property of the polymer solar cells, which depends on the material properties of the copolymer and the design of the solar cell.
6. High photocurrent: This is a performance property of the polymer solar cells, which depends on the material properties of the copolymer and the design of the solar cell.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| TA (copolymer) |
| 2-D extended conjugation (structural property) |
| HOMO level (quantum mechanical property, electron affinity) |
| Low band gap (material property, energy difference between valence and conduction bands) |
| High photo-voltage (performance property, voltage generated in the solar cells) |
| High photocurrent (performance property, electrical current generated in the solar cells) |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The weak electron - donating characteristic of TA , which has 2-D extended conjugation by thiophene side groups , makes the copolymer exhibit a low - lying HOMO level of -5.5 eV with a low band - gap of 1.65 eV , which affords both high photo - voltage and photocurrent of the polymer solar cells.

Let's think step by step.

1. TA: This is a chemical compound or polymer mentioned in the paragraph. It can be considered as a "Property Holder Entity" with the property being its weak electron-donating characteristic.
2. 2-D extended conjugation by thiophene side groups: This is a property or feature of TA. It can be considered as a "Property Value Entity" with the value being the two-dimensional extended conjugation.
3. -5.5 eV: This is a numerical value representing the energy level of the HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital) of the copolymer. It can be considered as a "Property Value Entity" with the property being the energy level and the value being -5.5 eV.
4. 1.65 eV: This is a numerical value representing the band gap of the copolymer. It can be considered as a "Property Value Entity" with the property being the band gap and the value being 1.65 eV.
5. high photo-voltage: This is a property or feature of the polymer solar cells. It can be considered as a "Property Value Entity" with the property being the photo-voltage and the value being "high".
6. high photocurrent: This is a property or feature of the polymer solar cells. It can be considered as a "Property Value Entity" with the property being the photocurrent and the value being "high".
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. -5.5 eV: This is a numerical value representing the energy level of the HOMO of the copolymer. It can be considered as a "Property Value Entity" with the property being the HOMO energy level and the value being -5.5 eV.
2. 1.65 eV: This is a numerical value representing the band gap of the copolymer. It can be considered as a "Property Value Entity" with the property being the band gap and the value being 1.65 eV.
3. high: This is a property or feature of the polymer solar cells, specifically referring to their photo-voltage and photocurrent. It can be considered as a "Property Value Entity" with the property being the level of photo-voltage and photocurrent and the value being "high".

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| HOMO energy level: -5.5 eV |
| Band gap: 1.65 eV |
| Photo-voltage and photocurrent: high |
